comments:
Build: I20070220-1330

Each time the details dialog is opened, it leaks five images. Sample stack trace from Sleak:

java.lang.Error
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java:58)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Device.new_Object(Device.java:786)

	at org.eclipse.jface.resource.ImageDescriptor.createImage(ImageDescriptor.java:205)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.runtime.logview.LogViewLabelProvider.<init>(LogViewLabelProvider.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.runtime.logview.EventDetailsDialog.<init>(EventDetailsDialog.java:100)

	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.runtime.logview.LogView$13.doubleClick(LogView.java:406)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer$1.run(StructuredViewer.java:798)

	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.fireDoubleClick(StructuredViewer.java:796)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.handleDoubleSelect(AbstractTreeViewer.java:1347)

	at org.eclipse.jface.util.OpenStrategy$1.handleEvent(OpenStrategy.java:295)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:938)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:3507)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:3121)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:2286)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runUI(Workbench.java:2250)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.access$4(Workbench.java:2125)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench$4.run(Workbench.java:459)
	at org.eclipse.core.databinding.observable.Realm.runWithDefault(Realm.java:289)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.createAndRunWorkbench(Workbench.java:454)
	at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createAndRunWorkbench(PlatformUI.java:149)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.application.IDEApplication.start(IDEApplication.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppHandle.run(EclipseAppHandle.java:146)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:106)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:76)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:354)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:169)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:85)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:58)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:60)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:391)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:476)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:416)

It looks like we might have forgotten to call dispose on our label provider upon closing an EventDetailsDialog.  This would have caused an image leak.  Thanks for finding this issue John.

In the midst of fixing it, I figured I would also improve memory cosumption by sharing the LogViewLabelProvider between the EventDetailsDialog and the LogView (instead of creating a new one for the EventDetailsDialog each time it comes up).  So we should no longer be leaking images and also should be using less memory ;-)
